Arithmetic in C++ Using Counting Pointers - Peter Hrenka - ACCU 2025 Short Talks
---

Learn how to implement arithmetic in C++ using counting pointers in this lightning talk by Peter Hrenka. This deep dive into C++ template metaprogramming demonstrates how to achieve compile-time arithmetic without using built-in integers, runtime execution, or `constexpr`. Instead, Peter explores a novel approach using pointer arithmetic in C++ — safely and entirely in type space.

If you're interested in type-level programming, pointer tricks, or pushing the limits of compile-time computation in C++, this talk is for you. Using recursive templates, the talk shows how to represent numbers as stacked pointers, implement addition, multiplication, and even exponentiation — all using C++ templates. This is not just metaprogramming; it’s metaprogramming with style.
